result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy J Toro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 60 days or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy J Toro

records.addlTxt:
08:46 AM Defendant Jeremy J Toro in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense advised defendant has completed AODA treatment and advised the Court of the agreement parties have reached.  State moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.
Court orders the following:

$367.50 to be paid within 60 days or civil judgment entered subject to collections, as penalty for non payment of fine.
Confidential Crime Victim Information

10:28 AM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Jeremy J Toro in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Singleton updates the court, he is waiting on a formal offer so he is requesting a projected plea and sentencing date in about 2 months.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on April 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

CONDTIONS MODIFIED ON 02/04/2022:    Defendant is not to have any VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

PREVIOUS CONDITIONS:
If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.

08:39 AM Defendant Jeremy J Toro in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Victim A appeared in court.

The Court calls the matter for the Defense's Motion to Modify Bail Conditions.
Attorney Singleton presents arguments and requests to modify from no contact, to no VIOLENT contact.
Victim A presents a statement. 
Attorney Woller presents statements and does not object as the victim requests the no VIOLENT contact. 
The Court places its findings on the record.
The Corut grants the Defense's motion.
The Court will modify bail to allow for no VIOLENT contact.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:39 AM Defendant Jeremy J Toro in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 4, 2022 at 08:15 am.

02:37 PM Defendant Jeremy J Toro in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Singleton objects to marsy's law and naming someone a victim before adjudication.
The Court will leave the previously set prelim hearing date.

Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.
